page.title: 12LAND CHANGE IN MERSEY VALLEY
page.content: On the Tithe Map of 1848 the land was mostly fields but the bleach works shown is still operating today. The last 20 years have seen dramatic changes.New housing estates and industrial estates have sprung up to almost cover the area. More than 50 units make up the estate mostly light industry,Photo printing light engineering and so on. The other major change reflects Transport Changes.The area was bisected by three major Railway lines from Stockport to Liverpool and Manchester to London.All barring one are now closed but a 3 line Motorway the M63 runs right through the valley. The view across the valley would be almost unrecognisable to a visitor from 100 years ago.
